definition: to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.chinese: 拿睡眠剝奪來舉個例子。

sentences.english: Cofie then had a goal disallowed on 35 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡35分鐘時的一個進球又被剝奪。

sentences.english: Boxing is about respect - getting it for yourself and taking it away from the other guy.
sentences.chinese: 拳擊是關於尊嚴，贏得你自己的，同時也剝奪別人的。

sentences.english: The law deprives criminals of their right to vote.
sentences.chinese: 法律剝奪了罪犯的選舉權。

sentences.english: Can say, confiscate what bring about pair of citizen money property right directly is privative with limitation.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，沒收直接導致對公民財產權的剝奪和限制。

sentences.english: After it is available, I am denied for the access to Bikram Yoga.
sentences.chinese: 它是可用後，我被剝奪了對高溫瑜伽訪問。

sentences.english: Provide for appropriate financial and cost analysis related to any proposed capital expenditures or divestitures .
sentences.chinese: 爲資金支出或財產剝奪提供正確的財政及成本分析。

sentences.english: They deprived him of his right to speak.
sentences.chinese: 他們剝奪了他說話的權利。

sentences.english: We are seeing dispossession on a massive scale.
sentences.chinese: 我們看到大量的土地被剝奪。

sentences.english: But ha was stripped very quickly by superior army authority, jiangchen be demotinged.
sentences.chinese: 但哈兒很快被上級剝奪了軍權，被貶江城。

sentences.english: Refugees have been deprived of their homes, but they must not be deprived of their futures.
sentences.chinese: 難民的家園已被剝奪，絕不能讓他們的未來也被剝奪。

sentences.english: Refugees have been deprived of their homes, but they must not be deprived of their futures.
sentences.chinese: 難民的家園已被剝奪，絕不能讓他們的未來也被剝奪。

sentences.english: This habit also robbed me of a chance of making easy money.
sentences.chinese: 嚴守時刻的習慣還剝奪我掙容易錢的機會。

sentences.english: God's axes of trial have stripped and bared them.
sentences.chinese: 神的斧子將我們剝奪得一無所有。

sentences.english: He had sought to deprive us of dime .
sentences.chinese: 他企圖剝奪我們一角錢。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
